Inquiry Institute

We partner with the Lester B. Pearson school board, Astro McGill, and BrainReach (also from McGill University) to bring inquiry-based activities to groups of primary school teachers.

More ›

Space Explorers

The Space Explorers program is a way for kids to explore physics in fun hands-on modules. Pairs of physics students visit local classrooms around 5 times over the course of a school year, giving primary school kids a chance to get to know a physicist, while doing educational activities.

More ›

Activities for your classroom

Our hands-on physics activities are developed with inquiry in mind. We welcome you to browse these activities, and modify them for use in your classroom.

More ›

Our volunteers facilitate fun and interactive activities in classrooms, at summer camps, and more.
